intro: Dendrobium tubiflorum f. albidiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered dendrobium, is a hybrid orchid species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its pendulous, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant is an epiphyte, typically growing on trees or rocks in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing a waxy surface to reduce water loss. This variety is prized in horticulture for its elegant appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
